td.content: s:a 27 YO white female presents with increased intrusive thoughts, lost weight and vivid flashbacks over 10 months. o:Height 176 cm, Weight 69.9 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 16, Special screening for other specified conditions (+) moderate depression per BDI Screen (27), avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent a:intrusive thoughts p:performed Special screening for other specified conditions, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to psychology.

td.content: s:27 YO white F chauffeur c/o 2 days h/o vivid flashbacks, intrusive thoughts and lost weight. Traumatized approx. 2 years ago when exposed to tornado. she denies smoking she drinks 2 beers per night o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. BDI 25, CAPS B=3,C=4,D=3. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, CAPS, and performed socialization to treatment - Explained that symptoms were common for someone having experienced such trauma; socialization to treatment - Discussed Safety Plan; counseling about life problems - Discussed other life issues - learned that Patient had concern about their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Suggested various social services available for helping to deal with their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Discussed with patient their social support network; Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation - Completed, and ordered homework (fill out standard intake forms), homework (read handouts about PTSD therapy).

td.content: s:27 yr old F chauffeur presents with 3 weeks history of worsening vivid flashbacks, intrusive thoughts and lost weight. Initial trauma: tornado. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Review of intake forms done, BDI 25, Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of intake forms, BDI, Suicide assessment, and performed socialization to treatment - Discussed homework - helped patient start to fill in goal worksheet; counseling about life problems - Discussed social services to help with their drug abuse; social service referral - Patient agreed they wanted to try NA; socialization to treatment - Discussed Cognitive-behavioral model of PTSD and that such treatments were mostly contraindicated until patient has stabilized and reduced level of anxiety; socialization to treatment - Discussed value of anxiety management exercises; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to list activities that were found to be relaxing; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to choose a previously close confidant to reengage with; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (finish writing goals for therapy), homework (set up appointment with social service), homework (participate in some of the activities identified as relaxing), homework (attempt to contact previously supportive person and talk with them).

Value.Value: Review of intake forms , BDI , Suicide

content2.Value: Review of intake forms , BDI , Suicide

Initial trauma: tornado. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Review of patient goals done. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of patient goals, and performed socialization to treatment - Reviewed Safety Plan in light of homework; counseling about life problems - Discussed patient interaction with NA; social service referral - Patient agreed to continue working with NA; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing), homework (Attempt to have second positive interaction with reengaged support person).

td.content: s:white f chauffeur aged 27 Ys presents with vivid flashbacks, lost weight and intrusive thoughts. she is having symptoms 15-17 x day, in spite of treatment. td.content: s:27 yo white F presents with feeling of guilt, difficulty concentrating and intrusive thoughts. These symptoms are present for about 5 weeks. Patient experienced trauma: tornado approx. 2 years ago. o:appropriate behavior with no abnormal movement, good eye contact, appears agitated, denies suicidal/homicidal ideation intent or plan, normal speech but slow rate, oriented x 3, poor concentration, affect is appropriate with normal range. Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Suicide assessment, and performed anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills).

td.content: s:27 year old white f chauffeur complains of nightmares, trouble sleeping and mild agitation. she does not take any recreational drugs. States that she experienced tornado. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. BDI 13. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, and performed socialization to treatment - Discuss with patient the good progress that they are making in therapy: better able to face the trauma, better able to handle their drug abuse, better able to interact with others; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees that they also see the progress; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees to delay follow-up date to 1 month out; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Discuss with patient their changes in interaction with others since therapy had begun; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.

td.content: s:Healthy 28 year old f chauffeur with C/O trouble sleeping, nightmares and mild agitation. pt experienced trauma: tornado approx. 2 years ago. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed socialization to treatment - Review Safety Plan; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Teach techniques for overcoming patient overgeneralizations; assessment of treatment progress - Discuss end-of-treatment scenarios; assessment of treatment progress - Patient suggests that there be one more session and then we try holding off on additional sessions; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice new cognitive modification techniques).
